node.title: Three waters co-governance debate diverts into privatisation
node.description: The government has hit back at arguments against co-governance in the three waters reforms, saying ACT's attack is a smokescreen for its privatisation agenda. Video

node.title: Navy "Hawkeye" radar plane crash kills one, injures two
node.description: The Navy says the Norfolk, Va.-based plane was conducting routine flight operations off the Virginia/Maryland border, near Wallops Island, Virginia, when it went down.

node.title: Auckland parking strategy set for public consultation
node.description: Auckland councillors have voted to progress a new parking strategy to public consultation.

node.title: Auditor-General finds failings in $290m tourism support scheme
node.description: Ministers used unclear criteria when dishing out tens of millions of dollars in tourism grants in 2020 and kept few records explaining their decisions.

node.title: Senators call for probes into Hertz after CBS News reports on alleged false arrests
node.description: Senators Elizabeth Warren and Richard Blumenthal are calling for investigations into the false arrest allegations and consolidation in the rental car industry.

node.title: Bruce Willis gives up acting due to brain disorder aphasia
node.description: Bruce Willis will retire from acting after being diagnosed with aphasia, a condition that impedes a person's ability to speak and write.

node.title: Four people in Dunedin Hospital contract Covid-19 after visit
node.description: Four people contracted Covid-19 after a person with the virus visited a patient at Dunedin Hospital.

node.title: Drought relief package for Southland Otago farmers
node.description: A $100,000 drought relief package for Southland and Otago farmers has been announced by the Agriculture Minister.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 22 deaths, 15,250 new cases, 830 in hospital
node.description: There have been 15,250 new cases of Covid-19 in the community and 22 more deaths reported in New Zealand today.

node.title: Farmers lean towards farm-level pricing in emissions consultation
node.description: Farmer consultation on an emissions pricing option for the agricultural sector has now closed, with the government due to be presented with a final option in May.

node.title: New Zealand now 'average' investor-friendly market
node.description: New Zealand has been downgraded to average when it comes to being an investor-friendly market in terms of fees and expenses.

node.title: Scott Morrison: Australian PM's own senator calls him autocrat and bully
node.description: An Australian government senator has accused Prime Minister Scott Morrison of being "an autocrat" and "a bully with no moral compass".

node.title: Biden plans to tap oil reserve to control gas prices
node.description: Energy prices have spiked as the U.S. and allies have imposed steep sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine.

node.title: National's Christopher Luxon won't commit to ruling out future co-governance referendum
node.description: National Party leader Christopher Luxon says he doesn't think New Zealand is ready for a referendum on co-governance but won't say whether he would rule one out altogether. Audio

node.title: Police seeking identity of man after Auckland shooting
node.description: Auckland police are asking for the public's help to identify a man, after shots were fired in a car park earlier this month.

node.title: Protest donations went into bank account of man with history of unpaid debt
node.description: A man whose personal bank account was used to receive donations for the Parliament protest is bankrupt and has been declared insolvent three times.

node.title: ACT accused of encouraging extremists with co-governance call
node.description: The ACT Party and Te Paati Māori are at odds over who is stoking division when it comes to co-governance.

node.title: 'Services whittled away': KiwiRail taken to task for ditching intercity trains
node.description: A campaign demanding a reliable train service between the regions is gaining steam.

node.title: Pluto's giant 'ice volcanoes' made from many recent smaller eruptions - study
node.description: When the New Horizons spacecraft zoomed past Pluto in 2015, it snapped photos of what appeared to be two massive ice volcanoes.

node.title: Chris Rock says he's still "processing" Will Smith slap
node.description: Rock returned to the stage Wednesday night in Boston for the first time since the Oscars.

node.title: Phoenix in top four
node.description: The Wellington Phoenix have jumped up to fourth on the A-League ladder after beating the Brisbane Roar 3-0.

node.title: Destinations differ for Phoenix and Breakers after starting journey together
node.description: Sports Call - Wellington Phoenix and New Zealand Breakers started their respective seasons in the same place but the end point will be very different.

node.title: Air Force hones precision skills and timing needed for supply drops
node.description: The New Zealand Air Force can be called on at any time to drop supplies into war zones or after disaster strikes, when landing and unloading are impossible.

node.title: Hubble spots oldest and most distant star ever recorded
node.description: The star may be up to 50 times the mass of our sun.

node.title: More than 60 flights cancelled as dense fog blankets Wellington Airport runway
node.description: Just one flight has been able to land this morning at Wellington Airport.

node.title: New details emerge about federal investigation into Hunter Biden
node.description: Multiple sources tell CBS News the probe is exploring whether the younger Biden and his associates violated tax, money laundering and foreign lobbying laws.

node.title: Institutions expect 5000 foreign student places to be snapped up
node.description: Schools, universities and other tertiary institutions are expecting little trouble filling the biggest intake of foreign students in two years.

node.title: "I was overjoyed": Mother and son each nominated for a Grammy
node.description: A mother and son who channeled their grief to create music have been independently nominated for Grammys.

node.title: Officer used excessive force to arrest tagger - IPCA
node.description: The Independent Police Conduct Authority has found a police officer who hit a tagger in Auckland's inner-city used excessive force.

node.title: Fair pay bill tipped for plenty of scrutiny during parliamentary process
node.description: The Fair Pay Agreements Bill is expected to bring about the biggest change to workplace laws in 30 years.
